_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Note:  This facility was previously part of the DuPont LaPorte Plant.  On April 30, 2004, the facility assets were purchased by INVISTA S.a.r.l. (formerly known as Arteva Specialties S.a.r.l.), a private company owned by a subsidiary of Koch Industries, Inc.


ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES

As a DuPont facility this site operated under DuPont Policies, Standards, and Guidelines which will remain in effect until they are replaced by the INVISTA SHE Policy, Management Systems, and Performance Standards appropriate to the hazard using the Management of Change Process.
  
DuPont Policies, Standards, and Guidelines are available in hard copy at the facility.  In addition the LaPorte site Emergency  Manual lays out the complete Emergency Response Program for the site.


FACILITY DESCRIPTION

The INVISTA LaPorte Plant consits of 24 acres, located approximately 20 miles East of the city of Houston, Texas, in a rural setting.

The site consists of manufacturing processes to produce Spandex Intermediates (PTMEG, THF, and BDO).  In the production of these products, the following regulated substance is used as raw material or intermediates:
- Formaldehyde (solution)


GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS

The INVISTA LaPorte Plant processes currently follow the requirements of DuPont Corporate SHE Standard S21A, ?Process Safety Management.?  This Standard includes and embraces the requirements of 29 CFR 1910.119 and 40 CFR Part 68.

Our Safety Programs include:

Designing for Safety?
- A documented process technology system covers hazards of materials, equipment design basis, and process design basis.
- Extensive accident prevention and mitigation systems are strategically located.
- Applicable codes and standards are met or exceeded.
- Materials of construction are chosen to provide mechanical integrity.
- Quality Assurance ensures fabrication in accordance with design specifications and proper ass

embly.

Maintaining our Plant?
- Maintenance personnel are trained and experienced.
- Contractors are trained and qualified.
- A work permit system controls hazards.

Operating Safety?
- Operators are trained and job qualified.
- Technical resources are available and utilized as required.
- Operators follow approved procedures.

Auditing our Operations?
- Routine safety inspections are conducted
- Corporate, independent and governmental audits and reviews are conducted.
- Process Hazards Analyses are conducted.
- Safety critical equipment is set up on a periodic inspection frequency to ensure ongoing mechanical integrity.
- Pre-startup safety reviews are conducted prior to starting up any new or modified equipment.
- Quality assurance of critical equipment ensures fabrication in accordance with design specifications.
- All incidents are investigated and actions taken to prevent recurrence.


THE FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

- No deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on-site.
- No known off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage has resulted from a release of the regulated chemical (Formaldehyde) in the past five years.


EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

Plant personnel are trained and equipped to respond to any release of the regulated chemical.  The program can be summarized as follows:

*Training and Preparation?
- Plant personnel receive emergency response training.
- Plant emergency responders, including INVISTA and DuPont personnel, are trained.
- Emergency response plans are current.
- Plant participates in emergency drills.
- Critiques are held on drills and actual events.

*If a Major Release Occurs?
- Emergency alarm is sounded.
- Plant Emergency Operating Center is activated.
- Plant Incident Commander and emergency squad respond.
- Community emergency responders are notified as appropriate.
